FuncDef:
The permit-domain-list command specifies a list of domains in which the users are allowed to access the BAS interface. Users in other domains are not allowed to access the BAS interface.
The undo permit-domain-list command cancels the previous configuration.
By default, users in all domains are allowed to access the BAS interface.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the list of domains in which the users are allowed to access the BAS interface. The domain list must have been created.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters excluding *, ?, and ". The value is not case sensitive.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The permit-domain-list command can be used to specify a list of domains in which the users are allowed to access the BAS interface.
Prerequisites
The access-type command has been run to set the access type to layer2-subscriber.
Configuration Impact
If the permit-domain-list command is run, only the users in the specified domains on the domain list can access the BAS interface. Otherwise, all domain users can access the BAS interface.
If the permit-domain-list command is run more than once to configure the list of domains whose users are allowed to access by using the BAS interface, the latest configuration overrides the previous one.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
The permit-domain-list command cannot be configured together with the deny-domain-list, deny-domain, or permit-domain command on one BAS interface.
